item.title: If you Understand TCP, you Understand Consent
item.description: If you can understand TCP, you can understand consent. It’s really quite simple. Here we’ll look at how TCP flags (the original six plus ECE and CWR) map to a conversation between two people. Let’s say you want to start talking to someone. In TCP, you start with the three-way handshake: You --- SYN --> Them You <--SYN/ACK--- Them You --- ACK --> Them In human terms, a SYN (synchronize) expresses that you’re asking to begin a conversation, and an ACK (acknowledge) is how you acknowledge what the other person has said.
